title: Requires the calculation of policyholder positions for mono line mortgage guaranty insurance companies
summary: Requires the calculation of policyholder positions for mono line mortgage guaranty insurance companies; defines "minimum policyholders positions" and prescribes other technical requirements for the unique contingency reserve required for mortgage guaranty insurers.

       Introduced  by M. of A. MORELLE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law,  in  relation  to  mortgage  guaranty
         insurance contingency reserves

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph 2 of subsection (a) of section 6502 of the insur-
    2  ance law is amended to read as follows:
    3    (2) it establishes a contingency reserve out of  net  premiums  (gross
    4  premiums less premiums returned to policyholders) remaining after estab-
    5  lishing  the  unearned  premium reserve. The company shall contribute to
    6  the contingency reserve an amount equal to fifty percent of such remain-
    7  ing earned premiums.   Contributions to  the  contingency  reserve  made
    8  during  each  calendar  year  shall  be  maintained  for a period of one
    9  hundred and twenty months, except that withdrawals may be  made  by  the
   10  company  with  the prior approval of the superintendent: (A) in any year
   11  in which the actual incurred losses exceed thirty-five  percent  of  the
   12  corresponding  earned  premiums  OR  (B)  OF SUCH OTHER APPROVED AMOUNT,
   13  PROVIDED THE COMPANY CONTINUES TO MEET THE OTHER  REQUIREMENTS  OF  THIS
   14  SECTION,  AND AFTER CONSIDERATION BY THE SUPERINTENDENT OF THE FINANCIAL
   15  CONDITION OF THE COMPANY, LOSS DEVELOPMENT AND TRENDS, AS  WELL  AS  ANY
   16  OTHER  CIRCUMSTANCES  THE  SUPERINTENDENT DEEMS APPROPRIATE. THE COMPANY
   17  SHALL SUBMIT  DOCUMENTATION  CLEARLY  PROVIDING  JUSTIFICATION  FOR  THE
   18  PROPOSED  WITHDRAWAL  OF CONTINGENCY RESERVES UNDER THIS PARAGRAPH.  The
   19  unearned premium reserve shall be computed as required  by  section  one
   20  thousand  three  hundred  five  of  this chapter except that on policies
   21  covering a risk period of more than one year it  shall  be  computed  in
   22  accordance with standards promulgated by the superintendent; and
   23    S 2.  This act shall take effect immediately; provided that the super-
   24  intendent of insurance is authorized to promulgate any and all rules and
   25  regulations,  on  an emergency basis, and take any other measures neces-
   26  sary to implement this act on its effective date.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
